documents.content:
# CalWORKs Stage 3 Child Care (2026)

## What is Stage 3?

Stage 3 provides long-term child care support for former CalWORKs families after they have been off cash aid for 24 months.

## Eligibility

- Former CalWORKs family
- Been off cash aid for at least 24 months
- OR received lump-sum diversion services (if Stage 2 funding not available)
- Income below 85% of State Median Income
- Child under age 13 (or under 22 with special needs)

## Important Difference from Stage 1 & 2

**NOT an entitlement:**
- Funding dependent - may have waiting lists
- Enrollment depends on available regional funding
- Contact your local APP to check availability

## Duration

You can remain in Stage 3 until:
- Family income exceeds 85% SMI, OR
- Children exceed eligibility age

## Family Fees

| Income Level | Monthly Fee |
|--------------|-------------|
| Below 75% SMI | $0 (no fee) |
| 75-85% SMI | ~1% of monthly income |

## Continuous Eligibility

- 24 months without reporting changes
- Only report if income exceeds 85% SMI

## Care Options

- Licensed child care centers
- Licensed family child care homes
- Before and after school programs
- License-exempt care (TrustLine registered if subsidized)

## How to Apply

1. Contact your local Alternative Payment Program (APP)
2. Complete application with income verification
3. May be placed on waiting list if funding limited

## Administration

Administered by: CDSS through Alternative Payment Programs (APPs)

**Find your local APP:** https://rrnetwork.org/family-services/find-child-care
**More Info:** https://www.cdss.ca.gov/inforesources/calworks-child-care
